intro: Chrysopsis californica, commonly known as the California goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to California and Baja California. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in coastal scrub habitats. It produces small, clustered flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Chrysopsis californica is a hardy, drought-tolerant species well adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native range.
